name: wakapi
description: Wakapi is a self-hosted WakaTime-like coding statistics tracker. It records editor activity via plugins and displays programming time, language stats, and trends via a web UI and API.
features: Coding time tracking: Automatically record time spent in your code editor with support for VS Code, IntelliJ, Vim, and more.
Language statistics: View detailed breakdowns of programming languages used, helping identify where you spend most coding time.
Project insights: Track time across different projects and repositories to understand workload distribution.
Daily summaries: Get comprehensive daily, weekly, and monthly reports showing coding activity patterns and trends.
Editor plugins: Install lightweight plugins that run in the background without impacting editor performance.
Privacy control: All data stays on your server with no external tracking or data sharing with third parties.
API access: Integrate with other tools using the REST API to build custom dashboards or automation workflows.
Leaderboards: Compare coding activity with team members through optional leaderboard features for friendly competition.
Goal setting: Define daily or weekly coding goals and track progress with visual indicators and notifications.
Data export: Export your coding statistics in various formats for portfolio building or performance reviews.
Heartbeat system: Efficient data collection sends activity heartbeats every few minutes to minimize resource usage.
Badge generation: Create embeddable badges showing coding stats for GitHub profiles or personal websites.
